ground_truth: He stares into her eyes and nods. Graham's eyes fill with tears as he reaches out to take her hand in his and stares at her, puzzled, through his wet eyes as her head lowers. Graham remembers his conversation with Merrill, and his eyes, glazed with tears, focus on the alien as it rocks back and forth, leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm. Graham turns slowly from the creature to face Merrill, spotting the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his brother. He turns back around to stare with stern determination at the alien. Merrill remains motionless, but then turns his gaze from the creature to Graham and looks behind him to the bat. The alien watches him, its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets. Merrill takes the bat down as the alien lowers its hand over Morgan's face, injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into Morgan's nose. The alien turns, and Merrill launches himself at the creature, striking it in the back, causing the alien to drop Morgan and turn to face its assailant. Graham rushes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped syringe while Merrill strikes the creature in its abdomen. It falls into a side table, knocking over a glass of water, and as the water spills onto its shoulder, an angry red wound erupts in its green-gray skin. Merrill and Graham stare around the room at the collection of discarded glasses of water, and Graham turns to Bo in astonishment before hurrying outside with Morgan in his arms, Bo following him. On the veranda, Bo looks back into the living room through a broken window as Graham heads out onto the lawn. Merrill swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table, and the alien recoils as its skin is splashed with liquid. Crouched on the lawn, Graham, holding his son across his thighs, adjusts the syringe and thrusts it into Morgan's leg. Merrill prepares for another strike, slamming the bat into the alien, causing the creature to topple over, landing on its back and knocking against a small sideboard, causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over, with water cascading down onto the crib. The broken head of the bat lies on the floor, surrounded by shards of glass, while the alien takes deep, difficult breaths, its chest sinking and failing to rise. Merrill hurries out into the garden and crouches down by Graham and Morgan. Graham, his eyes closed, cradles his limp son as Merrill presses Morgan's neck and recoils, turning away. Bo's face creases as she begins to sob, but then Graham opens his moistened eyes and his face shudders. Merrill swings round as Bo looks on in awe, and Graham turns, hardly daring to look at his son as Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He gazes into her eyes and nods. Graham's eyes brim with tears as he extends a hand to take her hand in his and gazes at her, perplexed, through his damp eyes as her head lowers. Graham recalls his dialogue with Merrill, and his eyes, glazed with tears, focus on the extraterrestrial as it sways back and forth, bending over its captive hanging limply over its arm. Graham rotates slowly from the creature to face Merrill, noticing the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his sibling. He rotates back around to stare with stern resolve at the extraterrestrial. Merrill remains immobile, but then shifts his gaze from the creature to Graham and looks behind him to the bat. The extraterrestrial observes him, its small eyes illuminating green in their recessed sockets. Merrill takes the bat down as the extraterrestrial lowers its hand over Morgan's face, injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into Morgan's nose. The extraterrestrial swivels, and Merrill propels himself at the creature, hitting it in the back, causing the extraterrestrial to drop Morgan and turn to face its assailant. Graham dashes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped syringe while Merrill hits the creature in its midsection. It collapses into a side table, overturning a glass of water, and as the water spills onto its shoulder, an angry red laceration erupts in its green-gray skin. Merrill and Graham gaze around the room at the collection of discarded glasses of water, and Graham turns to Bo in amazement before scurrying outside with Morgan in his arms, Bo trailing him. On the veranda, Bo looks back into the living room through a shattered window as Graham heads out onto the lawn. Merrill swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table, and the extraterrestrial recoils as its skin is splattered with liquid. Crouched on the lawn, Graham, holding his son across his thighs, adjusts the syringe and plunges it into Morgan's leg. Merrill readies for another blow, slamming the bat into the extraterrestrial, causing the creature to topple over, landing on its back and knocking against a small sideboard, causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over, with water cascading down onto the crib. The broken head of the bat rests on the floor, surrounded by fragments of glass, while the extraterrestrial takes deep, laborious breaths, its chest sinking and failing to rise. Merrill scurries out into the garden and crouches down by Graham and Morgan. Graham, his eyes closed, cradles his limp son as Merrill presses Morgan's neck and recoils, turning away. Bo's face crumples as she starts to sob, but then Graham opens his moistened eyes and his face quivers. Merrill swings round as Bo watches in amazement, and Graham turns, barely daring to look at his son as Morgan raises his head.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Staring into her eyes, a nod is given by him. Graham's eyes fill with tears as her hand is reached for and taken by him, his puzzled stare directed at her through his wet eyes as her head lowers. Graham remembers his conversation with Merrill, and his tear-glazed eyes focus on the alien as it rocks back and forth, leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm. Slow is his turn from the creature to face Merrill, who spots the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his brother. He turns back around, his stern determination staring at the alien. Motionless remains Merrill, but then his gaze is turned from the creature to Graham, and the bat is looked at behind him. The alien watches him, its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets. The bat is taken down by Merrill as the alien lowers its hand over Morgan's face, and a gray gash shoots from the spike into Morgan's nose. The alien turns, and Merrill launches himself at the creature, striking it in the back, causing Morgan to be dropped by the alien and turning it to face its assailant. Graham rushes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped syringe while the creature is struck in its abdomen by Merrill. Knocked into a side table, the alien falls, and a glass of water is knocked over, spilling onto its shoulder, with an angry red wound erupting in its green-gray skin. Around the room, Merrill and Graham stare at the collection of discarded glasses of water, and astonishingly, Graham turns to Bo before Morgan is hurried outside with him in his arms, Bo following. On the veranda, Bo looks back into the living room through a broken window as the lawn is headed onto by Graham. Merrill swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table, and liquid is splashed on the alien's skin as it recoils. Crouched on the lawn, Graham, holding his son across his thighs, adjusts the syringe and thrusts it into Morgan's leg. Preparing for another strike, Merrill slams the bat into the alien, causing the creature to topple over, land on its back, and knock against a small sideboard, causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over, with water cascading down onto the crib. On the floor lies the broken head of the bat, surrounded by shards of glass, while deep, difficult breaths are taken by the alien, its chest sinking and failing to rise. Out into the garden hurries Merrill and crouches down by Graham and Morgan. Eyes closed, Graham cradles his limp son as Morgan's neck is pressed by Merrill, who recoils and turns away. As Bo's face creases, a sob begins, but Graham's moistened eyes open, and his face shudders. Round swings Merrill as awe fills Bo's gaze, and Graham turns, hardly daring to look at his son as Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He stares into her eyes and nods. Graham, with tears in his eyes, reaches for her hand, puzzled. He recalls his talk with Merrill and shifts his tearful gaze to the alien rocking over its limp captive. Graham slowly turns from the creature to Merrill, noticing the baseball bat on the wall. He then focuses determinedly on the alien. Merrill, motionless, looks from the creature to Graham and then to the bat. The alien's small eyes glow green. Merrill grabs the bat as the alien injects Morgan’s nose with a gray spike. Merrill attacks the creature from behind, causing it to drop Morgan. Graham picks up Morgan and the syringe while Merrill hits the alien's abdomen. It crashes into a table, spilling water which burns its skin. Merrill and Graham look around at the scattered water glasses. Graham turns to Bo in surprise and rushes outside with Morgan, Bo following. On the veranda, Bo sees inside through a broken window as Graham moves onto the lawn. Merrill swings the bat at the glasses, splashing the alien. Crouched on the lawn, Graham injects Morgan’s leg. Merrill strikes the alien again, making it fall, knocking over more glasses. The bat breaks amid glass shards as the alien struggles to breathe. Merrill joins Graham in the garden. Graham, eyes closed, cradles Morgan as Merrill checks his pulse. Bo begins to sob, but Graham opens his eyes with a shudder. Merrill turns as Bo watches in awe, and Graham sees Morgan lift his head.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Graham nods, tears in his eyes, as he takes her hand and recalls his conversation with Merrill. He focuses on the alien leaning over its captive. Graham turns to Merrill, noticing the baseball bat on the wall. Merrill follows his gaze, takes the bat, and the alien injects Morgan. Merrill strikes the alien, making it drop Morgan. Graham grabs Morgan and the syringe as Merrill hits the alien, causing it to fall and spill water, revealing a red wound. Staring at the water glasses, Graham leaves with Morgan, followed by Bo. Merrill breaks glasses, splashing the alien, while Graham injects Morgan's leg. Merrill's strike topples the alien, knocking water onto the crib. The alien struggles to breathe, and Merrill joins Graham, cradling Morgan. Bo sobs, then watches in awe as Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
He fixates his penetrating gaze into her eyes and gently nods, acknowledging some unspoken understanding between them. Graham's eyes begin to brim with tears, emotions overwhelming him as he reaches out to tenderly take her hand in his own. His tear-filled eyes remain locked on hers, his expression puzzled, as her head gradually lowers in response. As this poignant moment unfolds, Graham's mind drifts back to his earlier conversation with Merrill. His own eyes, now glazed with unshed tears, shift their focus to the alien before him, its body swaying back and forth menacingly. The creature ominously leans over its captive, who hangs limply over its arm like a ragdoll. With deliberate slowness, Graham turns his attention away from this unsettling sight, directing his gaze towards Merrill. He spots the baseball bat securely nestled in its rack, which is mounted on the wall by his brother’s handiwork. Steeling himself, he turns back around, his eyes filled with stern determination as they fixate on the alien once more. 

Merrill, who has remained motionless thus far, finally shifts his gaze from the creature towards Graham. His eyes follow Graham’s earlier glance to the bat hanging behind him. Meanwhile, the alien keeps a watchful eye on them both, its small, eerie eyes glowing an unsettling green, deep within their sunken sockets. Merrill decisively takes the bat down from its resting place just as the alien begins to lower a sinister hand over Morgan’s face, a gray gash shooting forth from a spike into the boy’s nose in a disconcerting motion. Reacting swiftly, Merrill launches his body towards the creature, striking it in the back with the bat. This blow causes the alien to drop Morgan instantly and turn its attention to face its assailant. Seizing the moment, Graham rushes over to gather Morgan and the fallen syringe, while Merrill continues his assault, landing another strike to the creature's abdomen. 

The alien stumbles back into a side table, toppling it over, which results in a glass of water splashing onto its shoulder. To their astonishment, an angry red wound violently erupts in the alien’s green-gray skin where the water lands. Shocked yet resolute, Merrill and Graham dart their eyes around the room, noting the collection of discarded glasses of water. Graham, his face a mask of astonishment, turns to Bo before hastily heading outside with Morgan held securely in his arms, Bo trailing closely behind. 

On the veranda, Bo momentarily pauses to glance back into what is now a chaotic living room through the broken window. Meanwhile, Graham makes his way out onto the lawn, each step urgent. Inside, Merrill grips the bat with renewed determination, swinging it at glasses on the coffee table. The alien recoils in visible agony as its skin is splattered with more liquid. 

Positioned on the lawn, Graham carefully cradles his son, who rests across his thighs. He adjusts the syringe with a steady hand before thrusting it into Morgan’s leg, willing him to revive. Merrill, relentless in his defense, prepares for yet another strike. This one causes the alien to topple backwards, crashing onto its back and knocking against a small sideboard in the process. As it lands, the impact causes glasses perched precariously on the edge to tip over, releasing a cascade of water onto the crib. The broken head of the bat comes to rest on the floor, surrounded by glimmering shards of broken glass, while the alien lies wheezing, its chest struggling to rise and fall. Merrill, his heart pounding, rushes out into the garden, crouching down beside Graham and the motionless Morgan. With a solemn expression, Graham closes his eyes, cradling his limp son while Merrill touches Morgan’s neck and then recoils with uncertainty, turning away in despair. 

Bo’s face trembles as tears begin to spill down her cheeks, but just then, Graham’s eyes flutter open, wet with emotion, and his face quivers softly. Merrill, sensing something, spins around as Bo watches in awe. Graham, scarcely daring to let hope take root, turns slowly, his heart in his throat, as Morgan, with great effort, lifts his head, signaling life where there was once feared to be none.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
He fixes his unwavering, penetrating gaze into her eyes, subtly nodding to acknowledge an unspoken understanding that seems to pass between them in silence. Graham's eyes begin to fill slowly with tears, emotions threatening to overwhelm him as he reaches out to gently take her hand in his own. His tear-filled eyes remain firmly locked on hers, his expression one of confusion, as her head gradually lowers in response to his emotional state. As this poignant moment continues to unfold, Graham’s mind drifts back to the earlier conversation he had with Merrill. His own eyes, now glazed over with the unshed tears, shift their focus with great effort to the alien that stands before him, its body swaying back and forth with a menacing demeanor. The creature ominously leans over its captive, who hangs limply over its arm, reminiscent of a lifeless ragdoll. With deliberate slowness, Graham turns his attention away from this unsettling sight, directing his focused gaze towards Merrill. He spots the baseball bat securely nestled in its designated rack, which is mounted on the wall through the handiwork of his brother. Steeling himself, he turns back around, his eyes now filled with stern determination, once more fixating on the alien.

Merrill, who has been standing motionless up until this point, finally shifts his gaze from the menacing creature to Graham. His eyes then follow Graham’s earlier glance to the bat hanging behind him. Meanwhile, the alien keeps a watchful eye on them, its small, eerie eyes glowing an unsettling green from deep within their sunken sockets. Merrill decisively takes the bat down from its resting place, just as the alien begins to lower a sinister hand over Morgan’s face, a gray gash shooting forth from a spike into the boy’s nose in a disconcerting motion. Reacting with swift urgency, Merrill launches his body towards the creature, striking it forcefully in the back with the bat. This powerful blow causes the alien to drop Morgan instantly and redirect its attention towards its assailant. Seizing this critical moment, Graham rushes over to gather Morgan and the fallen syringe, while Merrill continues his relentless assault, delivering another fierce strike to the creature's abdomen.

The alien stumbles backward into a side table, causing it to topple over, which results in a glass of water splashing onto its shoulder. To their astonishment, an angry red wound violently erupts in the alien’s green-gray skin where the water lands. Shocked yet resolute, Merrill and Graham dart their eyes around the room, taking note of the collection of discarded glasses of water scattered about. Graham, his face a mask of astonishment and urgency, turns to Bo before hastily heading outside with Morgan held securely in his arms, Bo trailing closely behind him.

On the veranda, Bo momentarily pauses to glance back into what has now become a chaotic living room through the broken window. Meanwhile, Graham makes his way out onto the lawn, each step deliberate and urgent. Inside, Merrill grips the bat with renewed determination and vigor, swinging it at the glasses on the coffee table. The alien recoils in visible agony as its skin is splattered with more liquid from the glasses.

Positioned carefully on the lawn, Graham cradles his son tenderly, who rests across his thighs. He adjusts the syringe with a steady, determined hand before thrusting it into Morgan’s leg, desperately willing him to revive. Merrill, relentless in his defense of their home, prepares for yet another strike. This one causes the alien to topple backwards, crashing onto its back and knocking against a small sideboard in the process. As it lands with a heavy thud, the impact causes glasses perched precariously on the edge to tip over, releasing a cascade of water onto the crib. The broken head of the bat comes to rest on the floor, surrounded by glimmering shards of broken glass, while the alien lies wheezing, its chest struggling to rise and fall with each labored breath. Merrill, his heart pounding fiercely in his chest, rushes out into the garden, crouching down beside Graham and the motionless Morgan. With a solemn expression and a heavy heart, Graham closes his eyes, cradling his limp son while Merrill touches Morgan’s neck and then recoils with uncertainty, turning away in despair.

Bo’s face trembles as tears begin to spill down her cheeks, but just at that moment, Graham’s eyes flutter open, glistening with emotion, and his face quivers softly with hope. Merrill, sensing something has changed, spins around as Bo watches in awe. Graham, scarcely daring to let hope take root, turns slowly, his heart lodged in his throat, as Morgan, with a visible effort, lifts his head, signaling life where there was once feared to be none.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: With intense focus, he gazes deeply into her eyes and gives a subtle nod of understanding. As Graham's eyes brim with tears, he tenderly reaches out, enveloping her hand in his own, maintaining a steady gaze upon her, though his vision blurs with emotion. His brows furrow in a mix of confusion and sorrow as her head gently bows. In a moment of reflection, Graham recalls his earlier conversation with Merrill, causing his tear-glazed eyes to shift their focus onto the alien, which rocks back and forth while leaning over a captive draped languidly over its arm. Graham steadily shifts his attention away from the alien to face Merrill, his eyes catching sight of the baseball bat resting in its rack, mounted on the wall by his brother. Resolutely, he turns back to confront the alien, his expression one of firm determination. Meanwhile, Merrill remains rooted to the spot, his gaze locked onto the alien until he finally shifts his focus to Graham, before glancing behind him at the bat. The alien, with its small, glowing green eyes nestled in sunken sockets, observes their exchange. In one fluid motion, Merrill retrieves the bat as the alien lowers its hand over Morgan's face, a gray gash slicing from its spike into Morgan's nose. As the alien swivels, Merrill springs forward, swinging the bat with force, impacting the creature's back and causing it to drop Morgan, then turning in reaction to its attacker. Seizing the moment, Graham dashes to scoop up Morgan and the syringe that has fallen, as Merrill continues to batter the creature in its abdomen. The alien stumbles into a side table, tipping over a glass of water, and as the water spills onto its shoulder, its green-gray skin erupts in a furious red wound. Both Merrill and Graham scan the room, noting the scattered glasses of water, and Graham turns to Bo with astonishment before swiftly heading outside with Morgan cradled in his arms, Bo trailing closely behind. Out on the veranda, Bo glances back into the living room through a shattered window as Graham steps onto the lawn. Inside, Merrill swings the bat again, targeting glasses on the coffee table, and the alien recoils as liquid splashes onto its skin. Crouching on the lawn, Graham carefully positions his son across his thighs, adjusting the syringe and firmly injecting it into Morgan's leg. Merrill, gearing up for another attack, drives the bat into the alien, sending it sprawling onto its back, colliding with a small sideboard, triggering glasses to topple over, water cascading down onto the crib. The bat's broken head lies amidst shards of glass on the floor, while the alien gasps for breath, its chest struggling to rise and fall. Merrill, in urgent strides, joins Graham and Morgan on the lawn, crouching beside them. Eyes squeezed shut, Graham cradles his son's limp form as Merrill checks Morgan's neck and, recoiling, turns away in dismay. Bo's face crumples as she begins to sob, but then Graham opens his tear-filled eyes, his face trembling with anticipation. Merrill swiftly turns around as Bo watches in awe, and Graham, with bated breath, scarcely dares to look as Morgan slowly lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Graham, filled with emotion, locks eyes with her before turning his tearful gaze to the alien holding Morgan. Recalling his conversation with Merrill, Graham shifts his focus to the baseball bat mounted on the wall. Simultaneously, Merrill observes the alien's actions and grabs the bat as the creature's spike injects Morgan. Merrill charges at the alien, causing it to drop Morgan, and Graham quickly retrieves his son and the syringe. As the alien is struck by Merrill, water spills from a nearby glass, creating a raw wound on its skin. Realizing the water's effect, Merrill and Graham exchange astonished glances, prompting Graham to carry Morgan outside, with Bo following. Meanwhile, Merrill continues to splash the alien with water by hitting glasses, causing further injury. On the lawn, Graham administers the syringe to Morgan while Merrill strikes the alien again, making it collapse. With the alien incapacitated, Merrill joins Graham, who cradles Morgan with closed eyes. As Merrill checks Morgan's pulse with concern, Bo begins to sob, but relief washes over everyone when Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He stares into her eyes and nods. Graham's eyes fill with tears as he reaches out to take her hand in his and stares at her, puzzled, through his wet eyes as her head lowers. Graham remembers his conversation with Merrill, his brother and former minor league baseball player who always kept his bat nearby for sentimental reasons, and his eyes, glazed with tears, focus on the alien as it rocks back and forth, leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm. The extraterrestrial, a menacing figure with features reminiscent of popular depictions in science fiction, stands in stark contrast to the warm familiarity of the living room setting. Graham turns slowly from the creature to face Merrill, spotting the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his brother. He turns back around to stare with stern determination at the alien. Merrill remains motionless, but then turns his gaze from the creature to Graham and looks behind him to the bat. The alien watches him, its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets, the eerie color adding to the tension in the dimly lit room. Merrill takes the bat down as the alien lowers its hand over Morgan's face, injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into Morgan's nose, a distressing sight that underscores the alien's threat. The alien turns, and Merrill launches himself at the creature, striking it in the back, causing the alien to drop Morgan and turn to face its assailant. Graham rushes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped syringe, a device filled with an unknown, potentially dangerous substance, while Merrill strikes the creature in its abdomen. It falls into a side table, knocking over a glass of water, and as the water spills onto its shoulder, an angry red wound erupts in its green-gray skin, revealing water's corrosive effect on the alien biology. Merrill and Graham stare around the room at the collection of discarded glasses of water, remnants of Bo's habit of leaving them around the house out of fear of dehydration, and Graham turns to Bo in astonishment before hurrying outside with Morgan in his arms, Bo following him. On the veranda, the wooden structure that served as a family gathering place during peaceful evenings, Bo looks back into the living room through a broken window as Graham heads out onto the lawn. Merrill swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table, and the alien recoils as its skin is splashed with liquid. Crouched on the lawn, Graham, holding his son across his thighs, adjusts the syringe and thrusts it into Morgan's leg, hoping that it contains an antidote against the alien's toxin. Merrill prepares for another strike, slamming the bat into the alien, causing the creature to topple over, landing on its back and knocking against a small sideboard, causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over, with water cascading down onto the crib, an item once belonging to Graham's now-deceased wife, evoking poignant memories. The broken head of the bat lies on the floor, surrounded by shards of glass, while the alien takes deep, difficult breaths, its chest sinking and failing to rise. Merrill hurries out into the garden and crouches down by Graham and Morgan. Graham, his eyes closed, cradles his limp son as Merrill presses Morgan's neck and recoils, turning away. Bo's face creases as she begins to sob, but then Graham opens his moistened eyes and his face shudders. Merrill swings round as Bo looks on in awe, and Graham turns, hardly daring to look at his son as Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: He stares into her eyes and nods. Graham's eyes fill with tears as he reaches out to take her hand in his and stares at her puzzled through his wet eyes as her head lowers. Graham remembers his conversation with Merrill and his eyes glazed with tears focus on the alien as it rocks back and forth leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm. Graham turns slowly from the creature to face Merrill spotting the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his brother. He turns back around to stare with stern determination at the alien. Merrill remains motionless but then turns his gaze from the creature to Graham and looks behind him to the bat. The alien watches him its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets. Merrill takes the bat down as the alien lowers its hand over Morgan's face injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into Morgan's nose. The alien turns and Merrill launches himself at the creature striking it in the back causing the alien to drop Morgan and turn to face its assailant. Graham rushes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped syringe while Merrill strikes the creature in its abdomen. It falls into a side table knocking over a glass of water and as the water spills onto its shoulder an angry red wound erupts in its greengray skin. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Merrill and Graham stare around the room at the collection of discarded glasses of water and Graham turns to Bo in astonishment before hurrying outside with Morgan in his arms. Bo following him. On the veranda Bo looks back into the living room through a broken window as Graham heads out onto the lawn. Merrill swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table and the alien recoils as its skin is splashed with liquid. Crouched on the lawn Graham holding his son across his thighs adjusts the syringe and thrusts it into Morgan's leg. Merrill prepares for another strike slamming the bat into the alien causing the creature to topple over landing on its back and knocking against a small sideboard causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over with water cascading down onto the crib. The broken head of the bat lies on the floor surrounded by shards of glass while the alien takes deep difficult breaths its chest sinking and failing to rise. Merrill hurries out into the garden and crouches down by Graham and Morgan. Graham his eyes closed cradles his limp son as Merrill presses Morgan's neck and recoils turning away. Bo's face creases as she begins to sob but then Graham opens his moistened eyes and his face shudders. Merrill swings round as Bo looks on in awe and Graham turns hardly daring to look at his son. as Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He stares into her eyes and nods. Graham's eyes fill with tears as he reaches out to take her hand in his and stares at her puzzled through his wet eyes as her head lowers. Graham remembers his conversation with Merrill and his eyes glazed with tears focus on the alien as it rocks back and forth leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm. Graham turns slowly from the creature to face Merrill spotting the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his brother. He turns back around to stare with stern determination at the alien. Merrill remains motionless but then turns his gaze from the creature to Graham and looks behind him to the bat. The alien watches him its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets. Merrill takes the bat down as the alien lowers its hand over Morgan's face injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into Morgan's nose. The alien turns and Merrill launches himself at the creature striking it in the back causing the alien to drop Morgan and turn to face its assailant. Graham rushes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped syringe while Merrill strikes the creature in its abdomen. It falls into a side table knocking over a glass of water and as the water spills onto its shoulder an angry red wound erupts in its greengray skin. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: She stares into his eyes and nods. Olivia's eyes fill with tears as she reaches out to take his hand in hers and stares at him, puzzled, through her wet eyes as his head lowers. Olivia remembers her conversation with Alex, and her eyes, glazed with tears, focus on the dinosaur as it rocks back and forth, leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm. Olivia turns slowly from the creature to face Alex, spotting the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by her cousin. She turns back around to stare with stern determination at the dinosaur. Alex remains motionless, but then turns his gaze from the creature to Olivia and looks behind her to the bat. The dinosaur watches him, its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets. Alex takes the bat down as the dinosaur lowers its hand over Taylor's face, injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into Taylor's nose. The dinosaur turns, and Alex launches himself at the creature, striking it in the back, causing the dinosaur to drop Taylor and turn to face its assailant. Olivia rushes over to pick up Taylor and the dropped syringe while Alex strikes the creature in its abdomen. It falls into a side table, knocking over a glass of water, and as the water spills onto its shoulder, an angry red wound erupts in its green-gray skin. Alex and Olivia stare around the room at the collection of discarded glasses of water, and Olivia turns to Sam in astonishment before hurrying outside with Taylor in her arms, Sam following her. On the veranda, Sam looks back into the living room through a broken window as Olivia heads out onto the lawn. Alex swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table, and the dinosaur recoils as its skin is splashed with liquid. Crouched on the lawn, Olivia, holding her friend across her thighs, adjusts the syringe and thrusts it into Taylor's leg. Alex prepares for another strike, slamming the bat into the dinosaur, causing the creature to topple over, landing on its back and knocking against a small sideboard, causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over, with water cascading down onto the crib. The broken head of the bat lies on the floor, surrounded by shards of glass, while the dinosaur takes deep, difficult breaths, its chest sinking and failing to rise. Alex hurries out into the garden and crouches down by Olivia and Taylor. Olivia, her eyes closed, cradles her limp friend as Alex presses Taylor's neck and recoils, turning away. Sam's face creases as he begins to sob, but then Olivia opens her moistened eyes and her face shudders. Alex swings round as Sam looks on in awe, and Olivia turns, hardly daring to look at her friend as Taylor lifts her head.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He stares into her eyes and nods. Graham's eyes fill with tears as he reaches out to take her foot in his and stares at her, puzzled, through his wet eyes as her elbow lowers. Graham remembers his conversation with Merrill, and his eyes, glazed with tears, focus on the robot as it rocks back and forth, leaning over its captive hanging limply over its branch. Graham turns slowly from the automaton to face Merrill, spotting the tennis racket in its holder mounted on the ceiling by his brother. He turns back around to stare with stern determination at the robot. Merrill remains motionless, but then turns his gaze from the automaton to Graham and looks behind him to the racket. The robot watches him, its small eyes glowing orange in their sunken sockets. Merrill takes the racket down as the robot lowers its appendage over Morgan's face, injecting a blue streak shooting from the needle into Morgan's ear. The robot turns, and Merrill launches himself at the automaton, striking it in the back, causing the robot to drop Morgan and turn to face its assailant. Graham rushes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped pen while Merrill strikes the automaton in its chest. It falls into a coffee table, knocking over a vase of flowers, and as the water spills onto its shoulder, an angry red wound erupts in its blue-gray skin. Merrill and Graham stare around the room at the collection of discarded vases of flowers, and Graham turns to Bo in astonishment before hurrying outside with Morgan in his arms, Bo following him. On the balcony, Bo looks back into the living room through a broken door as Graham heads out onto the driveway. Merrill swings the racket at vases on the ottoman, and the robot recoils as its skin is splashed with liquid. Crouched on the driveway, Graham, holding his son across his thighs, adjusts the pen and thrusts it into Morgan's leg. Merrill prepares for another strike, slamming the racket into the robot, causing the automaton to topple over, landing on its back and knocking against a small cupboard, causing vases on the cupboard to tip over, with water cascading down onto the stroller. The broken head of the racket lies on the floor, surrounded by shards of glass, while the robot takes deep, difficult breaths, its chest sinking and failing to rise. Merrill hurries out into the field and crouches down by Graham and Morgan. Graham, his eyes closed, cradles his limp son as Merrill presses Morgan's wrist and recoils, turning away. Bo's face creases as she begins to sob, but then Graham opens his moistened eyes and his face shudders. Merrill swings round as Bo looks on in awe, and Graham turns, hardly daring to look at his son as Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He glances at her eyes and smiles. Graham's eyes flicker with curiosity as he gestures to take her hand in his and squints at her, intrigued, through his dry eyes as her head rises. Graham imagines his daydream with Merrill, and his eyes, shining with curiosity, focus on the alien as it sways side to side, crouching over its captive propped stiffly over its arm. Graham pivots swiftly from the creature to face Merrill, noticing the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his brother. He spins back around to glare with fierce conviction at the alien. Merrill remains motionless, but then shifts his gaze from the creature to Graham and peers behind him to the bat. The alien observes him, its small eyes glowing blue in their sunken sockets. Merrill removes the bat as the alien raises its hand over Morgan's face, creating a gray line spreading from the spike into Morgan's nose. The alien pivots, and Merrill hurls himself at the creature, tapping it on the back, causing the alien to release Morgan and swivel to face its opponent. Graham hurries over to lift up Morgan and the dropped syringe while Merrill taps the creature in its abdomen. It topples into a side table, displacing a glass of water, and as the water splashes onto its shoulder, an angry red mark appears on its green-gray skin. Merrill and Graham gaze around the room at the collection of scattered glasses of water, and Graham turns to Bo in disbelief before striding outside with Morgan in his arms, Bo trailing him. On the veranda, Bo glances back into the living room through a broken window as Graham heads out onto the patio. Merrill swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table, and the alien recoils as its skin is sprinkled with liquid. Squatting on the lawn, Graham, clutching his son across his thighs, rotates the syringe and slips it into Morgan's leg. Merrill readies for another swing, tapping the bat against the alien, causing the creature to stumble backward, landing on its back and bumping against a small sideboard, causing glasses on the sideboard to slide over, with water streaming down onto the crib. The splintered head of the bat lies on the floor, surrounded by shards of glass, while the alien takes short, labored breaths, its chest deflating and failing to rise. Merrill rushes out into the garden and squats down by Graham and Morgan. Graham, his eyes closed, embraces his still son as Merrill taps Morgan's neck and draws back, turning away. Bo's face crinkles as she begins to laugh, but then Graham opens his softened eyes and his face twitches. Merrill swivels around as Bo looks on in amazement, and Graham turns, scarcely daring to glance at his son as Morgan lifts his head.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The toaster stares into the lamp's eyes and nods. The sock’s eyes fill with tears as it reaches out to take the lamp’s hand in its and stares at the lamp, puzzled, through its wet eyes as the pencil’s head lowers. The sock remembers its conversation with the bicycle, and its eyes, glazed with tears, focus on the chair as it rocks back and forth, leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm. The sock turns slowly from the book to face the bicycle, spotting the kite in its rack mounted on the wall by its suitcase. It turns back around to stare with stern determination at the chair. The bicycle remains motionless, but then turns its gaze from the book to the sock and looks behind it to the kite. The chair watches the loaf, its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets. The bicycle takes the kite down as the chair lowers its hand over the pebble’s face, injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into the pebble’s nose. The chair turns, and the bicycle launches itself at the book, striking it in the back, causing the chair to drop the pebble and turn to face its assailant. The sock rushes over to pick up the pebble and the dropped thread while the bicycle strikes the book in its abdomen. It falls into a side table, knocking over a glass of water, and as the water spills onto its shoulder, an angry red wound erupts in its green-gray skin. The bicycle and the sock stare around the room at the collection of discarded glasses of water, and the sock turns to the cloud in astonishment before hurrying outside with the pebble in its arms, the cloud following it. On the veranda, the cloud looks back into the living room through a broken window as the sock heads out onto the lawn. The bicycle swings the kite at glasses on the coffee table, and the chair recoils as its skin is splashed with liquid. Crouched on the lawn, the sock, holding its fruit across its thighs, adjusts the thread and thrusts it into the pebble’s leg. The bicycle prepares for another strike, slamming the kite into the book, causing the book to topple over, landing on its back and knocking against a small sideboard, causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over, with water cascading down onto the crib. The broken head of the kite lies on the floor, surrounded by shards of glass, while the chair takes deep, difficult breaths, its chest sinking and failing to rise. The bicycle hurries out into the garden and crouches down by the sock and the pebble. The sock, its eyes closed, cradles its limp fruit as the bicycle presses the pebble’s neck and recoils, turning away. The cloud's face creases as it begins to sob, but then the sock opens its moistened eyes and its face shudders. The bicycle swings round as the cloud looks on in awe, and the sock turns, hardly daring to look at its fruit as the pebble lifts its head.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She examines the sky and blinks. Lucy's hands tremble with excitement as she stretches out to grasp his shoulder in hers and examines him, bewildered, through her wide eyes as his head lowers. Lucy recalls her conversation with Martin, and her hands, shaky with anticipation, lock on the sculpture as it sways gently, bending over its captive resting awkwardly over its arm. Lucy pivots slowly from the artifact to face Martin, noticing the golf club in its holder attached to the wall by his roommate. She pivots back to examine with fierce focus at the sculpture. Martin remains still, but then shifts his gaze from the artifact to Lucy and glances behind her to the club. The sculpture observes her, its large hands glowing blue in their recessed sockets. Martin lifts the club out as the sculpture stretches its arm over Emma's face, releasing a silver mist flowing from the nozzle into Emma's nose. The sculpture swivels, and Martin propels himself at the artifact, tapping it in the shoulder, causing the sculpture to release Emma and swivel to confront its attacker. Lucy dashes over to scoop up Emma and the fallen vial while Martin taps the artifact in its torso. It collapses into a coffee table, toppling over a vase, and as the liquid spills onto its foot, a vibrant red mark erupts in its blue-gray surface. Martin and Lucy glance around the room at the assortment of overturned vases, and Lucy turns to Max in surprise before hurrying outside with Emma in her arms, Max trailing her. On the porch, Max glances back into the living room through a shattered doorway as Lucy heads out onto the grass. Martin swings the club at vases on the bookshelf, and the sculpture flinches as its surface is splashed with liquid. Kneeling on the grass, Lucy, holding her daughter across her knees, positions the vial and injects it into Emma's arm. Martin prepares for another strike, smashing the club into the sculpture, causing the artifact to stumble backward, landing on its side and knocking against a small cabinet, causing vases on the cabinet to topple over, with liquid cascading down onto the cot. The broken head of the club rests on the floor, surrounded by fragments of ceramic, while the sculpture takes slow, labored breaths, its chest sinking and failing to rise. Martin rushes out into the yard and kneels down next to Lucy and Emma. Lucy, her eyes closed, holds her limp daughter as Martin feels Emma's wrist and recoils, turning aside. Max's expression tightens as he starts to cry, but then Lucy opens her brightened eyes and her expression shakes. Martin pivots around as Max watches in wonder, and Lucy turns, barely able to look at her daughter as Emma raises her head.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He gazes into her elbows and shakes his head. Graham's ears fill with mist as he extends his foot to grasp her knee with his and gawks at her, puzzled, through his misty ears as her shoulders rise. Graham recalls his conversation with Merrill, and his ears, glazed with mist, center on the squirrel as it twirls left and right, balancing over its captive draped loosely over its beak. Graham pivots slowly from the creature to glare at Merrill, noticing the tennis racket in its slot mounted on the ceiling by his sibling. He pivots back around to gaze with stern confusion at the squirrel. Merrill stays frozen, but then shifts his vision from the creature to Graham and peers above him to the racket. The squirrel observes him, its large ears glowing purple in their shallow sockets. Merrill takes the racket down as the squirrel raises its feather over Morgan's toes, injecting a black ripple shooting from the brush into Morgan's ear. The squirrel rotates, and Merrill propels himself at the creature, tapping it in the ankle, prompting the squirrel to release Morgan and rotate to confront its aggressor. Graham dashes over to gather Morgan and the abandoned pencil while Merrill taps the creature in its knee. It crashes into a dining chair, toppling over a jug of juice, and as the juice splashes onto its elbow, a furious blue mark erupts in its orange-pink skin. Merrill and Graham stare around the room at the array of scattered jugs of juice, and Graham turns to Bo in amazement before darting indoors with Morgan in his legs, Bo trailing him. On the porch, Bo glances back into the bedroom through a shattered curtain as Graham marches out onto the rooftop. Merrill flails the racket at jugs on the tea trolley, and the squirrel shrinks as its skin is splattered with liquid. Hunched on the rooftop, Graham, cradling his daughter across his ankles, adjusts the pencil and drives it into Morgan's toe. Merrill readies for another tap, slashing the racket into the squirrel, causing the creature to stagger over, landing on its side and bumping against a giant armoire, causing jugs on the armoire to tumble over, with juice streaming down onto the cot. The broken handle of the racket rests on the carpet, surrounded by fragments of china, while the squirrel takes slow, laborious sighs, its back arching and ceasing to sink. Merrill rushes inside into the garage and stoops down by Graham and Morgan. Graham, his ears closed, embraces his drooping daughter as Merrill nudges Morgan's ankle and retreats, turning aside. Bo's hands contort as she begins to giggle, but then Graham opens his moistened ears and his hands quiver. Merrill spins round as Bo observes in wonder, and Graham turns, barely daring to view his daughter as Morgan raises her elbow.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She gazes into the mirror and winks. Sandra's cheeks flush with embarrassment as she picks up the feather in her hand and gazes at it, confused, through her blurred vision as the feather drifts downward. Sandra recalls her chat with Patrick, and her cheeks, flushed with warmth, turn toward the panda as it sways side to side, draping its scarf loosely over its shoulder. Sandra shifts her posture slowly from the panda to face Patrick, noticing the umbrella in its stand positioned by his sister. She swivels back to look with fierce intent at the panda. Patrick remains motionless, then changes his focus from the panda to Sandra and glances past her to the umbrella. The panda observes her, its tiny ears flashing red in their furry heads. Patrick picks the umbrella up as the panda lowers its paw over Lila's forehead, tracing a bright line tracing from the claw into Lila's cheek. The panda swivels, and Patrick propels himself at the beast, hitting it on the spine, making the panda release Lila and turn to confront its attacker. Sandra dashes over to collect Lila and the fallen pen while Patrick jabs the beast in its belly. It collapses against a bookshelf, tipping over a bowl of fruit, and as the fruit rolls onto its paw, a bright blue mark spreads across its brown-orange fur. Patrick and Sandra glance around the space at the assortment of scattered bowls of fruit, and Sandra turns to Timmy in disbelief before rushing indoors with Lila in her embrace, Timmy trailing after her. On the porch, Timmy peers back into the parlor through a shattered pane as Sandra strides out onto the patio. Patrick flings the umbrella at bowls on the dining table, and the panda shrinks back as its fur is splattered with juice. Kneeling on the grass, Sandra, holding her daughter against her hip, aligns the pen and plunges it into Lila's arm. Patrick braces for another attack, slamming the umbrella into the panda, making the beast topple forward, crashing onto its front and bumping against a low cabinet, causing bowls on the shelf to tilt, with fruit tumbling down onto the bed. The broken tip of the umbrella rests on the carpet, surrounded by seeds, while the panda takes long, labored breaths, its stomach rising and failing to fall. Patrick rushes out onto the sidewalk and crouches beside Sandra and Lila. Sandra, her eyes open, cradles her relaxed daughter as Patrick presses Lila's back and jumps, turning aside. Timmy's mouth stretches as he starts to whimper, but then Sandra closes her bright eyes and her shoulders shake. Patrick spins around as Timmy watches in reverence, and Sandra turns, barely able to gaze at her daughter as Lila tilts her chin.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Graham, teary-eyed, confronts an alien holding his son Morgan. Remembering his conversation with Merrill, Graham spots a baseball bat on the wall. As the alien injects Morgan with a substance, Merrill takes the bat, striking the creature, causing it to release Morgan. Graham quickly retrieves his son and the syringe. The alien falls into a table, spilling water on its skin, revealing a vulnerability. As Graham rushes outside with Morgan, Merrill smashes glasses of water at the alien, causing it pain. Graham injects Morgan with the syringe, while Merrill continues to attack the alien until it collapses. In the garden, Graham cradles Morgan, who begins to stir, to the immense relief of Graham, Merrill, and Bo.

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: Merrill prepares for another strike slamming the bat into the alien causing the creature to topple over landing on its back and knocking against a small sideboard causing glasses on the sideboard to tip over with water cascading down onto the crib Crouched on the lawn Graham holding his son across his thighs adjusts the syringe and thrusts it into Morgan's leg Graham remembers his conversation with Merrill and his eyes glazed with tears focus on the alien as it rocks back and forth leaning over its captive hanging limply over its arm Merrill swings the bat at glasses on the coffee table and the alien recoils as its skin is splashed with liquid Merrill remains motionless but then turns his gaze from the creature to Graham and looks behind him to the bat On the veranda Bo looks back into the living room through a broken window as Graham heads out onto the lawn The broken head of the bat lies on the floor surrounded by shards of glass while the alien takes deep difficult breaths its chest sinking and failing to rise Bo following him as Morgan lifts his head The alien watches him its small eyes glowing green in their sunken sockets Graham rushes over to pick up Morgan and the dropped syringe while Merrill strikes the creature in its abdomen Graham's eyes fill with tears as he reaches out to take her hand in his and stares at her puzzled through his wet eyes as her head lowers Graham his eyes closed cradles his limp son as Merrill presses Morgan's neck and recoils turning away Merrill and Graham stare around the room at the collection of discarded glasses of water and Graham turns to Bo in astonishment before hurrying outside with Morgan in his arms It falls into a side table knocking over a glass of water and as the water spills onto its shoulder an angry red wound erupts in its greengray skin Merrill swings round as Bo looks on in awe and Graham turns hardly daring to look at his son He turns back around to stare with stern determination at the alien Merrill hurries out into the garden and crouches down by Graham and Morgan Merrill takes the bat down as the alien lowers its hand over Morgan's face injecting a gray gash shooting from the spike into Morgan's nose The alien turns and Merrill launches himself at the creature striking it in the back causing the alien to drop Morgan and turn to face its assailant He stares into her eyes and nods Graham turns slowly from the creature to face Merrill spotting the baseball bat in its rack mounted on the wall by his brother Bo's face creases as she begins to sob but then Graham opens his moistened eyes and his face shudders

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
